summary: This document is an email chain from August 13, 2019, between officials at the U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) New York Field Office. The emails discuss the immediate aftermath of Jeffrey Epstein's death, focusing on securing the scene, obtaining initial reports from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP), and scheduling voluntary interviews with Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) staff. The Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (OCME) is also mentioned as requesting information.

events.title: Epstein Found Deceased in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The email discusses securing the cell and obtaining initial reports from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) regarding the finding of the body.

events.title: OIG Coordinates Scene Security and Interviews
events.description: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General New York Field Office coordinates via email to confirm the MCC cell is secured, obtain BOP reports for the OCME, and schedule voluntary interviews with MCC staff regarding the incident.

locations: U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General New York Field Office, One Battery Park Plaza, 29th Floor, New York, NY 10004
keyFacts: The email chain is dated August 13, 2019, the day after Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).
The Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (OCME) requested initial BOP reports on the finding of Epstein and the position of the body, and physical descriptions of officers Thomas and Noel.
The DOJ OIG was working to secure Epstein's cell as a crime scene and confirmed that union-represented MCC employees wanted union representation present during interviews.
The OIG was scheduling voluntary interviews with multiple MCC staff members who worked shifts on August 9 and August 10, 2019, surrounding the time of Epstein's death.
